Public health nurses and other vaccine providers are not required to wear gloves when giving babies immunizations. Vaccine providers ensure infection prevention and control through handwashing or alcohol-based hand sanitizers before preparing vaccines and between patients. The Canadian Immunization Guide does not routinely recommended gloves unless the skin on the vaccine provider's hands is not intact (cuts, blisters, etc).
